meanings.definition: A slit or notch made by a cutting tool.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter carefully measured the wood before making a kerf in it.
meanings.sent2: The saw left a clean kerf in the wooden plank.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel hid its acorn in the kerf of the tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight cast shadows through the kerf in the old barn door.
meanings.sent5: The kerf in the paper allowed the scissors to glide smoothly through.

meanings.definition: To make a cut or slit in (something).
meanings.sent1: She kerfed the cardboard to create a flap for the box.
meanings.sent2: The chef kerfed the vegetables before sautéing them.
meanings.sent3: The kids kerfed the playdough into funny shapes.
meanings.sent4: The tailor kerfed the fabric with precision before sewing.
meanings.sent5: He kerfed the leather to start crafting a new belt.
